<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Sacral Lord](/Feats.aspx?ID=3837) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Champion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=24" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=319" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 177</row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) or Trained in [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)

</column>

---

By right of ritual or sheer stubbornness, you have claimed rulership of the land. Claim a defined territory, such as a small section of forest or river, or a district of a larger city. Within its borders, you can cast [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [_guidance_](/Spells.aspx?ID=142), and [_sigil_](/Spells.aspx?ID=286) as innate divine cantrips, and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) on creatures that have the [celestial](/Traits.aspx?ID=23), [fiend](/Traits.aspx?ID=70), [fey](/Traits.aspx?ID=69), [monitor](/Traits.aspx?ID=111), or [spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=149) traits.

**Special** You and your land are linked. Changes to one mirror themselves on the other—if you're depressed, gray rain and clammy mist might set in. These effects have no immediate mechanical impact, but they might give clues about problems afflicting the land.

<title level="2">Sacral Lord leads to...</title>
[Sacral Monarch](/Feats.aspx?ID=3838)
name: Sacral Lord
prerequisite: Trained in Occultism or Trained in Religion
